009package imagingbook.common.util;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013import java.lang.reflect.Field;
014import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
015import java.util.ArrayList;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
019import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
020
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * Interface to be implemented by local 'Parameters' classes. This is part of
025 * the 'simple parameter object' scheme, working with public fields. Only
026 * non-static, non-final, public fields are accepted as parameters.
027 * Current features include: 
028 * <br>
029 * (a) Makes parameter bundles printable by listing all eligible fields.
030 * <br>
031 * (b) Parameter bundles can be added/modified as a whole by ImageJ's
032 * {@link GenericDialog}, supported by specific annotations (use methods
033 * {@link DialogUtils#addToDialog(ParameterBundle, GenericDialog)} and
034 * {@link DialogUtils#getFromDialog(ParameterBundle, GenericDialog)}).
035 * <br>
036 * See the example in {@code DemoParameters} below. Other functionality may be
037 * added in the future.
038 * </p>
039 * <pre>
040 * // Sample parameter bundle:
041 * 
042 * enum MyEnum { A, B, Cee };
043 * 
044 * static class DemoParameters implements ParameterBundle {
045 *      public static int staticInt = 44; // currently static members are listed too!
046 * 
047 *      &#64;DialogLabel("Make a decision:")
048 *      public boolean someBool = true;
049 *      public int someInt = 39;
050 *      public float someFloat = 1.99f;
051 * 
052 *      &#64;DialogLabel("Math.PI")
053 *      &#64;DialogDigits(10)
054 *      public double someDouble = Math.PI;
055 *      public String someString = "SHOW ME";
056 * 
057 *      &#64;DialogHide
058 *      public String hiddenString = "HIDE ME";
059 *      public MyEnum someEnum = MyEnum.B;
060 * }
061 * 
062 * public static void main(String[] args) {
063 *      ParameterBundle params = new DemoParameters();
064 *      System.out.println("p1 = \n" + params.printToString());
065 * 
066 *      GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(ParameterBundle.class.getSimpleName());
067 *      gd.addNumericField("some single int", 123, 0);
068 *      params.addToDialog(gd);
069 * 
070 *      gd.showDialog();
071 *      if (gd.wasCanceled())
072 *              return;
073 * 
074 *      int singleInt = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
075 *      boolean success = params.getFromDialog(gd);
076 *      System.out.println("success = " + success);
077 *      System.out.println("p2 = \n" + params.printToString());
078 * }
079 * </pre>
080 * 
081 * @author WB
082 * @version 2022/02/02
083 * @version 2022/09/14 moved annotations and methods for {@link GenericDialog} to {@link DialogUtils}
084 * 
085 * @see DialogUtils.DialogDigits
086 * @see DialogUtils.DialogLabel
087 * @see DialogUtils.DialogHide
088 */
089public interface ParameterBundle {
090        
091        default Field[] getValidParameterFields() {
092                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
093                List<Field> validFields = new ArrayList<>();
094                for (Field f : clazz.getFields()) {
095                        if (isValidParameterItem(f)) {
096                                validFields.add(f);
097                        }
098                }
099                return validFields.toArray(new Field[0]);
100        }
101        
102        default String printToString() {
103                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
104                try (PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas)) {
105                        printToStream(strm);
106                }
107                return bas.toString();
108        }
109
110        default void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
111                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
112                if (!Modifier.isPublic(clazz.getModifiers())) {
113                        strm.print("[WARNING] class " + clazz.getSimpleName() + " should be declared public or protected!\n");
114                }
115                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
116//              strm.println(clazz.getCanonicalName());
117                for (Field field : fields) {
118//                      if (!isValidParameterItem(field)) {
119//                              continue;
120//                      }
121                        strm.print(field.getType().getSimpleName() + " ");
122                        strm.print(field.getName() + " = ");
123                        try {
124                                strm.print(field.get(this).toString());
125                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { 
126                                strm.print("FIELD VALUE UNREADABLE!");
127                        }       
128                        strm.println();
129//                      int modifiers = field.getModifiers();
130//                      strm.println("Field is public = " + Modifier.isPublic(modifiers));
131//                      strm.println("Field is final = " + Modifier.isFinal(modifiers));
132                }
133        }
134        
135        /**
136         * Validates the correctness and compatibility of the
137         * parameters in this bundle. 
138         * Implementing classes should override this method.
139         * 
140         * @return true if all parameters are OK, false otherwise
141         */
142        default boolean validate() {
143                return true;
144        }
145        
146        static boolean isValidParameterItem(Field f) {
147                int mod = f.getModifiers();
148                if (Modifier.isPrivate(mod) || Modifier.isFinal(mod) || Modifier.isStatic(mod)) {
149                        return false;
150                }
151                else {
152                        return true;
153                }
154//              Class<?> clazz = f.getType();
155//              if (clazz == boolean.class || clazz == int.class || clazz == long.class || clazz == float.class || clazz == double.class || 
156//                      clazz == String.class || clazz.isEnum())
157//                      return true;
158//              else
159//                      return false;
160        }
161
162//      static void printModifiers(Field f) {
163//              int mod = f.getModifiers();
164//              System.out.println("Modifiers of field " + f.getName());
165//              System.out.println("abstract     = " + Modifier.isAbstract(mod));
166//              System.out.println("final        = " + Modifier.isFinal(mod));
167//              System.out.println("interface    = " + Modifier.isInterface(mod));
168//              System.out.println("native       = " + Modifier.isNative(mod));
169//              System.out.println("private      = " + Modifier.isPrivate(mod));
170//              System.out.println("protected    = " + Modifier.isProtected(mod));
171//              System.out.println("public       = " + Modifier.isPublic(mod));
172//              System.out.println("static       = " + Modifier.isStatic(mod));
173//              System.out.println("strict       = " + Modifier.isStrict(mod));
174//              System.out.println("synchronized = " + Modifier.isSynchronized(mod));
175//              System.out.println("transient    = " + Modifier.isTransient(mod));
176//              System.out.println("volatite     = " + Modifier.isVolatile(mod));
177//      }
178
179        
180        /**
181         * Returns a shallow copy of the specified {@link ParameterBundle}
182         * instance.
183         * 
184         * @param <T> generic type
185         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
186         * @return a copy with the same type, fields and values as the original instance
187         */
188        public static <T extends ParameterBundle> T duplicate(T params) {
189            return ObjectUtils.copy(params);
190        }
191
